citeinfo.origin: Russian Federal Research Institute of Marine Fisheries and Oceanography (VNIRO), Laboratory of Marine Ecology
citeinfo.title: Interannual Variability of Ice Formation in the Okhotsk and Bering Seas during 1995-1999

descript.abstract: The analysis of weekly SST maps constructed at VNIRO on basis of satellite data for the 1995-1999 period was carried out. As it is known, formation of ice interrupts the process of air-sea interaction delaying the extension of winter convection into deep water. Ice cover acts as an isolator preventing the sea from cooling. In this paper I consider duration and dates of beginning and ending of ice period of various aquatories of the Okhotsk and Bering Seas during 1995-1999. In the eastern Sea of Okhotsk the duration of ice margin staying south of 53 N was selected as a criterium of ice cover extension.
descript.purpose: To show the interannual variability of Ice Formation in the Okhotsk and Bering Seas during 1995-1999
